intro: Diasperus loandensis, commonly known as the Loando spurge, is a flowering plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are alternate and simple, often with a waxy coating to reduce water loss. The flowers are small and clustered, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
